alert.note: Alert for Lake; McHenry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 14 at 3:07PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following areas, Central Cook, DuPage, Kane, Lake IL, McHenry, Northern Cook and Southern Cook. * WHEN...Until Midnight CDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of heavy rainfall will accompany showers and thunderstorms this afternoon and evening across northeastern Illinois. Rainfall rates in excess of one inch per hour are likely, with isolated rainfall rates over two inches per hour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch for flash flooding means rapid-onset flooding is possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Flash flooding is a dangerous situation. Persons with interests along area rivers, creeks, and other waterways should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
